questions.text: A 20-Year-old female was brought to the OBG OPD for examination as she was a case of a victim of incest and was examined by the senior obstetrician. The MTP if required in such cases is done up to how many weeks of gestation according to the new MTP Act Amendment Bill 2021?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

24 weeks The changes brought about in the recent MTP Act Amendment Bill – March 2021 are – Medical termination of pregnancy in cases of survivors of rape, victims of incest, and women with fetal anomalies is extended upto 24weeks of gestation. Medical termination of pregnancy in cases of failure of contraception is still considered to be 20 weeks of gestation. The upper limit will not apply in cases of sustainable fetal anomalies. The sustainable risk of the child being born due to fetal anomalies are decided by a panel of – (i) an Obstetrician (ii) a Radiologist (iii) a Paediatrician (iv) A member from the state government or union territory allocated The MTP Act needs validation from an Obstetrician/ Registered Medical Practitioner for 20 weeks and 2 doctors for 24 weeks. Failure of contraception for ‘married woman and her husband ‘ is replaced by ‘ woman and her partner’. Strict rules for the protection of the privacy of the woman by the doctor.
